content:
Deleting or renaming popstate.dat should force a download of all messages.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Popstate.dat

Rebuilding the sqlite file only resets the global search database in case search results are incorrect.

content: Gmail doesn't work like a normal POP server would. Messages are marked as already downloaded at the server. If you want already downloaded messages to be downloaded again, you have to use webmail and make that happen in Gmail Settings > Forwarding and POP/IMAP.
creator: DavidGG

content: See https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1489899

content:
The simple answer is to turn auto-save off and tap Ctrl+S every few minutes to save what you've typed. But check first with an email addressed to yourself that Ctrl+S isn't having the same effect.

btw, are you getting emails from the recipients that they are receiving multiple emails? Are there multiple Sent emails in the Sent emails folder?

creator: yjh9152

content:
This is IMAP or POP?

The main problem at the root of not receiving emails is Third Party Anti-Virus software. I'd suggest that, if you have any installed (especially Norton or Bitdefender), you switch off Email protection temporarily and see if it's magically resolved.

You could start Windows in Safe Mode with Networking but that would be pretty much the same reason for switching off Email Protection.

Apart from that, I don't have a solution for you. Please respond so that this question goes back into the list of problems that need resolving.
creator: frisée

content: Explanation is here - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1475561

content:
As soon as you said 'elderly friend', I felt the hairs on the back of my neck stand up. I look over a couple of elderly people's computers and, amongst other things, the amount of times they click-drag folders and files across their email accounts is frightening - with consequences that have me frequently baffled.

I'm not sure I'll be able to help but there have been a couple of posts recently where people have complained that functionality has been compromised - and it's become apparent a few posts in that the file structure is something worthy of a horror movie plot.

Before someone could help, I think we need a screenshots of the file structure (with any personal info like email addresses) removed. Is this an IMAP or POP account? How many of each? Thunderbird is on a computer?? Which version of Thunderbird are you using? Which Operating System are you using?

We can manually delete some folders on the HD but it really needs to be seen what the extent of the problem is first.
creator: frisée
